title: Issues with video analysis with DLC 2.rc3
body:
******************** DLC 2.rc3 with GUI Operating System: CentOS 7 (Linux) ******************** Hello, I have a question about analyzing video files (.mpg) in the latest version of DLC. The training worked great but now I would like to analyze my videos. This seems to work as well. DLC takes ~ 4-6 min to analyze my video. however, no csv nor h5 file is shown in the output folder. Which is why I canâ€™t create a video then. Additional info: I do a single animal analysis (so not maDLC). Please place code inside this:
Code output

[Using snapshot-1030000 for model /home/djenderny/DLC/OF/OF_Masterthesis-DJ-2021-06-24/dlc-models/iteration-0/OF_MasterthesisJun24-trainset95shuffle1 2021-07-02 15:22:13.274915: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1733] Found device 0 with properties: pciBusID: 0000:1a:00.0 name: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 Ti computeCapability: 7.5 coreClock: 1.545GHz coreCount: 68 deviceMemorySize: 10.76GiB deviceMemoryBandwidth: 573.69GiB/s 2021-07-02 15:22:13.276899: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1871] Adding visible gpu devices: 0 2021-07-02 15:22:13.277009: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1258] Device interconnect StreamExecutor with strength 1 edge matrix: 2021-07-02 15:22:13.277026: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1264] 0 2021-07-02 15:22:13.277051: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1277] 0: N 2021-07-02 15:22:13.278236: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1418] Created TensorFlow device (/job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/device:GPU:0 with 2934 MB memory) -> physical GPU (device: 0, name: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 Ti, pci bus id: 0000:1a:00.0, compute capability: 7.5) Starting to analyze % /home/djenderny/DLC/OF/male/WT/cropped/OF_08W_2577_WTcropped.mpg /home/djenderny/DLC/OF/male/WT/cropped already exists! Loading /home/djenderny/DLC/OF/male/WT/cropped/OF_08W_2577_WTcropped.mpg Duration of video [s]: 304.92 , recorded with 25.0 fps! Overall # of frames: 7623 found with (before cropping) frame dimensions: 706 722 Starting to extract posture 7676it [02:57, 43.04it/s] Starting to analyze % /home/djenderny/DLC/OF/male/WT/cropped/OF_40W_2484_WTcropped.mpg /home/djenderny/DLC/OF/male/WT/cropped already exists! Loading /home/djenderny/DLC/OF/male/WT/cropped/OF_40W_2484_WTcropped.mpg Duration of video [s]: 306.8 , recorded with 25.0 fps! Overall # of frames: 7670 found with (before cropping) frame dimensions: 730 740 Starting to extract posture 7676it [03:09, 40.51it/s] Saving results in /home/djenderny/DLC/OF/male/WT/cropped... Saving csv poses! 7676it [06:08, 20.83it/s] The videos are analyzed. Now your research can truly start! You can create labeled videos with 'create_labeled_video' If the tracking is not satisfactory for some videos, consider expanding the training set. You can use the function 'extract_outlier_frames' to extract a few representative outlier frames. ]

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. go to "Analyze video" 2. Click on "add video" 3. also wanted to get .csv file 4. analyze video (~3-6 min) 5. No output in the video folder **Screenshots** ![analyze1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66160679/124281873-77dd8080-db4a-11eb-813d-96f185576478.jpg) ![analyze2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66160679/124281880-790ead80-db4a-11eb-9dc0-c2e408584b16.jpg) ![analyze3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66160679/124281876-78761700-db4a-11eb-9e9a-248fa23d34c8.jpg) does it make sense to convert the video files? since i can't select .mpg.
